eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyInfo: Narantuya refuses to embark on her traditional Nightzmoran Khaganquest and is trapped within the illusion, but Aspasia shatters it by chasing Woof away. Pepe awakens to find herself surrounded by sand.

attributes.text: You should all bless me. Bless me with a dance under the morning sun and the tapping of your scabbards.
—Oh, right, I forgot you sold your swords. Then beat the pots and pans. Play the anvil like a drum with your pens.
They say the roads of Menat-Ha'mait are paved with jewels. Well, I'm heading for that road now.
I know most of you will tell me to stop being delusional. But why can't I make it rich?
Why can't I buy us the best life?

attributes.content: Where am I—?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: —Oh, my departure ceremony! I must have danced myself dizzy.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I give you my blessing, Narantuya.
attributes.name: Cheerful Former Desert Bandit

attributes.content: There's a caravan I know that regularly visits the City of Radiance. If you do make it there, seek them out.
attributes.name: Cheerful Former Desert Bandit

attributes.content: Hah, I knew you'd have some useful connections!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: One more friend, one less trouble. Thanks for the blessing.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I'm still worried, Narantuya.
attributes.name: Doubtful Former Desert Bandit

attributes.content: About what? How many times have I told you? No one's going to get revenge on you when I'm gone.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: This has nothing to do with you. You chose to work for me and not Asim because I'm just that charming.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Old Asim resents me for it and speaks ill of me everywhere he goes, but he's just being petty.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: And those jealous haters had to band together and set me up... my fault I'm so lucky that I attract both gold and people.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: But you're the one I'm worried about, Narantuya.
attributes.name: Doubtful Former Desert Bandit

attributes.content: if you just wander into the desert with an empty satchel, what will you do when you can't find water or beasts?
attributes.name: Doubtful Former Desert Bandit

attributes.content: Huh? I know we somehow ended up poorer than we started, but I'm sure I at least have some coins for jerkies and preserved fruits.
attributes.name: Narantuya
Narantuya
attributes.content: Why would you think that? Has anyone been starving without telling me? Who is it?

attributes.name: Narantuya
attributes.content: I'll give them some coins right now—
attributes.joined: Why would you think that? Has anyone been starving without telling me? Who is it?I'll give them some coins right now—

attributes.content: Narantuya reaches into the purse at her waist.
As her eyes slowly widen in disbelief, she unties the beast hide pouch, turns it inside out, and begins shaking it.
A few grains of sand fall onto the endless desert.
Strange. I don't remember bumping into a beggar or vagrant...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Actually, I vaguely remember crossing paths with a few rich men?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya, I thought it over, and I think I should teach you my secret to finding water in the desert.
attributes.name: Doubtful Former Desert Bandit

attributes.content: I don't have to worry about becoming a sacrificial tribute to a bandit chief anymore, so there's no need to keep this a secret any longer.
attributes.name: Doubtful Former Desert Bandit

attributes.content: —Good. I like this blessing.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The sands can enjoy those lost coins then.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I'm worried too, Narantuya.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Hmm? And what are you worried about? That I'll abduct another child slave from a caravan who will replace you as most illiterate?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I'm worried about the two black blades of yours. You haven't used or maintained them for a long time.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: It's precisely because maintenance is a chore that I avoid using these antiques. I much prefer modern materials and mechanical forging—
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: —Wait, where are my blades? And my dagger? And my supply of paralyzing toxins and spore casks?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: *sigh* I'm worried about your tendency to pick up new recruits, Narantuya.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: You'll be setting out alone. It's great if you could get some useful crew. But most of the time, it's people like me and Ajazi that you have to save...
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: 'Setting out alone'? You girls aren't coming with me to the City of Radiance?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...which is why Ajazi and I worked for two months in a logging camp and threw all the coins we saved into a river they say flows into the City of Radiance.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: I hope you will find them when the river floods, and that your Khaganquest goes smoothly...
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Okay, I appreciate this blessing too, even though the rainforest is at the downstream of the river.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Wait.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Did you say Khaganquest?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Yes, your Khaganquest.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: You're all set for it, right?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: No? When did that happen?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Come to think of it, I am indeed 'all by myself with nothing but the weapons from my parents' right now...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Meh, pass on the city. I'm out!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The young Nightzmora turns and strides over to her burdenbeast pack.
At that same moment, towering walls rise up from the sand. Even part of the piercing sunlight seems to be blocked off.
Where are my burdenbeasts? And my tent?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya rubs her eyes.
As if trapped in a nightmare of her own making, her field of vision narrows until only one path remains.

attributes.text: 'Step forth, prove your bravery, embark on your Khaganquest.'

attributes.content: No way! This Khaganquest is too scary! I'll die!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Help——!!!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Strange. The metal constructs here are not moving.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Someone's on the ground? Hello, can you hear me? Hold on, I'm on my way—
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: ——Out of my way!
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: What did you say?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I was just lying on the ground and a giant beckbeast had its paw on my head?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I think it's a beckbeast, but I failed to catch the creature before it vanished into the sand and dust.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: It's no wonder my head hurt while I was dreaming. There was a voice I heard making 'oowoo...' sounds. My face is fine though, right?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Phew.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: How did you chase the beckbeast away? I spent so long yelling at it in my dream with no luck.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The situation was urgent, so I resorted to force.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Wow, why didn't I think of that? Sometimes violence is the solution!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I knew you'd be a reliable subordinate. Thanks a lot—
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Wait no, you're not a subordinate.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...We'd best be leaving. These constructs could start moving at any time. It's not safe here.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Seems pretty safe to me.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: *sigh* The river god presented me with a chance to prove my heroism, and I ended up falling asleep on the street...?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The dream was nice though, at least the first half of it.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...The streets are in chaos, while you lay on the sands... and had a good dream?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Yup. I dreamed about my departure ceremony. Everyone was cheering me on. Even their beat was spot on.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: How nice would it be, if my former subordinates were actually that supportive when I was setting out for Menat-Ha'mait!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I talked to Ajazi and Ajani briefly, after you left the hotel.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Did they tell you most people think I'm delusional?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: They did.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: But consider this: if one has to eventually wake from one's dream, why not indulge in a bit of fantasy before that happens?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (Can't help but laugh)
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Perhaps there remains much of each other that we do not know.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: But for now, I'm simply glad to see you safe.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Aspasia extends her hand to Narantuya.
So, does that mean we're all good—
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: —Hold on.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What's wrong, Ajani?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya! Help!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: The museum! Isn't safe! At all!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: —Who's there?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Titi, did you say something? I heard something...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I didn't.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: ...But I heard it too.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Uh, no way...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Can these artifacts talk?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Ugh... Why didn't they say anything before?!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Guardian of eternity. Please answer. Please answer. Please answer.
attributes.name: Jewel Construct

attributes.content: Answer what?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: He who led the outlanders to stride upon the earth, forsaking their ships from this domain. His legions, brandishing golden blades, shielded the reckless and inquisitive travelers.
attributes.name: Jewel Construct

attributes.content: Bitter and sweet, his chalice did contain, drawn from those who traversed through his realm. In the sands beneath his feet, rest bones and charred stones from the distant northwest.
attributes.name: Jewel Construct

attributes.content: Tell me, the 'name' that people remember him by.
attributes.name: Jewel Construct

attributes.content: ...Anat.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I don't think they can actually 'talk', at least, they're not capable of conversation.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: They're just presenting riddles—like when you're prompted to enter a combination of numbers to open a safe.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: B-But! What kind of complex riddle is this?!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The countdown has begun. Three minutes remaining.
attributes.name: Jewel Construct

attributes.content: Ahhhhh!!!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Now we've turned it into a ticking time bomb!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: —Wait, Anat! Calm down!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Can you contact any of the museum staff?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Wh-What for...?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I think this might be a riddle about history.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I remember now... what about that favorite book of yours, Terra: A Journey? Where is it?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Titi, look up the section on Bolívar's history for me, please!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: ...You ask of Padishah Beyad, who agreed to establish an Iberia-Sargon-Bolívar trade route and subsequently brought in Bolívarian sugar cane and coffee beans.
attributes.name: Anat
Anat
attributes.content: 'Corrupted by the land's blight, tiny skulls strung on leather tight. Clanking with agony, from their plight. Hunted they are, day and night...'

attributes.name: Anat
attributes.content: I know! Chapter three, beasts of Terra.
attributes.joined: 'Corrupted by the land's blight, tiny skulls strung on leather tight. Clanking with agony, from their plight. Hunted they are, day and night...'I know! Chapter three, beasts of Terra.

attributes.content: You ask of sandbeast. There was a trend in sixth-century Sargon to hunt sandbeasts.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The museum used to have strings of sandbeast heads hung up to ward off evil, though we always saw it as a needless worship of nature.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: But... since you've witnessed that history. You should know that the real reason for hunting sandbeasts was that a small number of them mutated from high concentration of local active Originium, right?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Okay, next construct and riddle, please.
attributes.name: Anat
Anat
attributes.content: 'At the lake's bottom, their ruins dwell. Heirs of an old bloodline, many fell. Executed with blades that gleamed. They turned on their own, it seemed...'

attributes.name: Anat
attributes.content: I remember this one. Go to the end of the races of Terra.
attributes.joined: 'At the lake's bottom, their ruins dwell. Heirs of an old bloodline, many fell. Executed with blades that gleamed. They turned on their own, it seemed...'I remember this one. Go to the end of the races of Terra.

attributes.content: A riddle suited for archaeologists. There was an ancient settlement from a thousand years ago where we found signs of group executions, but we excavated torture instruments made of modern alloy materials.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: You're right, the answer is written here. Petram, a race practically no one has seen, are those who inherited unique smelting and forging techniques from the olden times
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Okay, next question...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The constructs' riddles are solved as the pages turn, and they gradually settle down.
They stop in a circle around Anat, like a group of silent listeners.
Anat recalls the moment right before she gave her first speech. Titi taught her to imagine the audience as museum artifacts to calm her nerves.
'Just keep talking about the things you know are true, Anat.'
Phew, this is taboo to say, but the Sarkaz did indeed set foot in Sargon once. We still don't know the full extent of their ancient curse.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Come to think of it, this is how you've inspired me.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Huh? You mean the curse?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: No. I used to not get it.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Sargon's written history dates back to when other nations were still in their primitive states. When you left Sargon to explore these lands, I wondered what more you hoped to learn.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: That's why I chose to read Terra: A Journey.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I saw within our limited time on this land that we hold too many misunderstandings and prejudices.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The greatest show of bravery we can perform is to expend our finite lives on our search through the infinity of time.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Yeah, we're no actual guardians of eternity, so there's no way we can experience everything ourselves.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Speaking of which, if you ever got the chance... would you become an immortal like Zubayr, and witness ancient history with your own eyes?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Actually, I've been thinking... if these constructs are using history riddles to verify if we are worthy of controlling them...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Then what was the word that activated this verification mode of theirs?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: And what exactly was their creator thinking when they chose this command word—'Horakhet'?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: It's dark... Where am I?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'm... in that monster's belly...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I can hear the wind...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Phew... what's up ahead...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: A lake in the desert...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: An emerald lake lies in the center of the golden sands. The palm trees by its shore sway in the gentle breeze, creating the rustling sound Pepe heard earlier.
A boy is half submerged in the water. After a moment, he suddenly sits up with a beautiful golden fin in hand.
He holds the fin with both hands, and carefully makes his way towards Pepe.
Uh, kid, do you know...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Look at my catch, sister!
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: Sister? Who're you calling sister?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: What... are you talking about?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Father says he plans to bury Mother here, in her hometown.
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: He also wants to erect a beautiful tomb for her, with a pretty pond full of lotuses.
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: I will leave this golden fin in that pond, and it will keep Mother company for me.
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: What's that got to do with me?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Sister...
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: Stop calling me that! You don't look anything like my brother!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Father... will continue with his expedition. Mother's departure will not stop him.
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: He asked us if we wished to stay here or follow him eastward.
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: Um... what are you talking about, boy? I can't make sense of what you're saying.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I wish to follow Father to the east, to see and conquer lands farther away than here.
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: Come with me, sister. Bring your reed pen and papyrus, you will see many sights worth recording, and I shall accomplish great undertakings, as Father has.
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: I will become the protagonist of your writings!
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: Let's go together, sister!
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: Hey, li'l guy, I'll have to pass...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: I'll follow you and Father, Zubayr.
attributes.name: Gentle Girl

attributes.content: Who...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe turns her head and sees a girl holding a white lotus, with a similar golden lotus on her forehead, sparkling in the sun.
The decoration reminds Pepe of something, and she lightly touches her own head.
At that moment, the sun seems to make her head spin.
